raw_json.html_title: üåç Data Science for Open WASH Data: Building a Global Community! | R-bloggers
raw_json.main_html:
üåç Data Science for Open WASH Data: Building a Global Community!

Posted on August 31, 2025 by Adriana Clavijo Daza in R bloggers | 0 Comments

[This article was first published on openwashdata, and kindly contributed to R-bloggers]. (You can report issue about the content on this page here)
Want to share your content on R-bloggers? click here if you have a blog, or here if you don't.

We‚Äôre thrilled to have 124 registrations so far from passionate learners worldwide who are ready to transform water, sanitation, and hygiene data into actionable insights! üìä

üó∫ Global reach, diverse perspectives: Our participants span continents, with African countries leading the way. We have 15 registrations from Ghana, followed by strong representation from Uganda (13 registrations), Switzerland (10 registrations) and Ethiopia (10 registrations). Also very exciting to see a strong female participation with 36% of the registrations. You‚Äôre creating an inclusive learning environment where diverse voices will enrich our experience. ü§ù

üìö Meeting learners at every level: While 70% of participants hold advanced degrees and 48% are employed full-time, 86% are beginners in R programming. This mix creates a unique learning environment where everyone brings valuable perspectives. Whether you‚Äôre taking your first steps in coding or bringing years of WASH expertise we‚Äôre ready to support you in this path of adding data science to your toolkit. üíª‚ú®

ü§ñ AI-powered learning: With 100% of participants already using AI tools (most popular: ChatGPT, Gemini, Copilot for Microsoft 365), we‚Äôre excited to include our bonus module: ‚ÄúUse of AI for coding support‚Äù. This module will help all participants ‚Äì from beginners to experienced coders ‚Äì leverage AI tools effectively and responsibly in their data science journey.

Join this vibrant community committed to using data science for open research and data. Together, we‚Äôre building the knowledge to tackle water and sanitation challenges. üåä

Visit the course website if you are interested in learning more about the contents and structure. Registrations are still open: https://ee-eu.kobotoolbox.org/single/7V3qeDYD

Related

To leave a comment for the author, please follow the link and comment on their blog: openwashdata.
R-bloggers.com offers daily e-mail updates about R news and tutorials about learning R and many other topics. Click here if you're looking to post or find an R/data-science job.
